metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: SQL Syntax
SQL Statements
Most of the actions you need to perform on a database are done with SQL statements.
content.html: Most of the actions you need to perform on a database are done with SQL statements.

content.text: SQL statements consist of keywords that are easy to understand.
content.html: SQL statements consist of keywords that are easy to understand.

content.text: The following SQL statement returns all records from a table named "Customers":
content.html: The following SQL statement returns all records from a table named "Customers":

content.code_html: SELECT * FROM Customers;

content.text: In this tutorial we will teach you all about the different SQL statements.
content.html: In this tutorial we will teach you all about the different SQL statements.

content.text: Database Tables
A database most often contains one or more tables. Each table is identified by a name (e.g. "Customers" or "Orders"), and contain records (rows) with data.
content.html: A database most often contains one or more tables. Each table is identified by a name (e.g. "Customers" or "Orders"), and contain records (rows) with data.

content.text: In this tutorial we will use the well-known Northwind sample database (included in MS Access and MS SQL Server).
content.html: In this tutorial we will use the well-known Northwind sample database (included in MS Access and MS SQL Server).

content.text: Below is a selection from the Customers table used in the examples:
content.html: Below is a selection from the Customers table used in the examples:

content.code_html:
CustomerID CustomerName ContactName Address City PostalCode Country
1

 Alfreds Futterkiste Maria Anders Obere Str. 57 Berlin 12209 Germany
2 Ana Trujillo Emparedados y helados Ana Trujillo Avda. de la Constitución 2222 México D.F. 05021 Mexico
3 Antonio Moreno Taquería Antonio Moreno Mataderos 2312 México D.F. 05023 Mexico
4

 Around the Horn Thomas Hardy 120 Hanover Sq. London WA1 1DP UK
5 Berglunds snabbköp Christina Berglund Berguvsvägen 8 Luleå S-958 22 Sweden

content.text: The table above contains five records (one for each customer) and seven columns (CustomerID, CustomerName, ContactName, Address, City, PostalCode, and Country).
content.html: The table above contains five records (one for each customer) and seven columns (CustomerID, CustomerName, ContactName, Address, City, PostalCode, and Country).

content.text: Keep in Mind That...
In this tutorial we will write all SQL keywords in upper-case.
content.html: In this tutorial we will write all SQL keywords in upper-case.

content.text: Semicolon after SQL Statements?
Some database systems require a semicolon at the end of each SQL statement.
content.html: Some database systems require a semicolon at the end of each SQL statement.

content.text: Semicolon is the standard way to separate each SQL statement in database systems that allow more than one SQL statement to be executed in the same call to the server.
content.html: Semicolon is the standard way to separate each SQL statement in database systems that allow more than one SQL statement to be executed in the same call to the server.

content.text: In this tutorial, we will use semicolon at the end of each SQL statement.
content.html: In this tutorial, we will use semicolon at the end of each SQL statement.

content.text: Some of The Most Important SQL Commands
Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which SQL statement is used to select all records from a table named 'Customers'?
